data.title: Added pavement to the Tiberian Sun mod
data.body: It isn't rendered for reasons unknown to me.

data.title: Graphical glitches in the main menu
data.body:
I sometimes get graphical glitches when returning to the main menu screen (playtest 20150405):

![menu_broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/7001629/7d4e7f00-dc3d-11e4-8c8b-6a29079eae37.jpg)
![menu_broken2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/7001630/7f7fe20a-dc3d-11e4-9135-55c66ab641d7.jpg)

It seems to be caused by ALT-TABing out of the game to another window (Firefox running java) and returning to the game. So far it only appeared in the main menu - even if the gameplay looked OK after "returning" to the game's window (so after going back to the menu). It doesn't happen every time, and it happened after watching replays and after regular games as well.

I have shellmap disabled, using pseudo-fullscreen mode and running Windows 8.1 with Intel HD graphics.

**UPDATE:**
The easiest way to reproduce this seems to be to ALT-TAB while you're switching mods. 
- once I managed to freeze Windows (8.1) while doing this
- sometimes you lose sight of the mouse pointer (but the mouse works, you can see menu buttons changing color when you manage to hover over - might be a separate issue)
- sometimes the menus doesn't get displayed (not even text) (when it happened the OS froze)

data.title: Proper TS alpha cloak rendering.
data.body:
Draw cloaked TS actors at alpha 140 with new `AlphaPaletteEffect`.

![screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/XTpj0xO.png)

![snow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/7001586/3faa8d5a-dc02-11e4-8cc8-99296e187914.png)

I ended up with something prettier than this but didn't get a gif of it. The code can be found in the logs.
![gify](http://i.imgur.com/T6y2Igx.gif)

data.title: Add upgrade rules support for map PlayerReferences
data.body:
Split off from #7873, because that needs to be able to upgrade the PlayerReferences in maps.
This just adds support for that. The other PR will add the first use-case.

I used [this commit](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commit/cb32f8aa80542c7f059bc62df6f4bdc043260eaf) as example and now the PlayerReferences are loaded as MiniYAML by the map and kept that way.

Reviews should start with `Map.cs`, because that is where all the action is happening. Most of the rest is noise.

**Edit:** The action has moved to `MapPlayers.cs` now, but it all still starts from `Map.cs`.

data.title: Add TS features required for a full remake
data.body:
Features that need to be added for a (nearly) complete remake:
- [x] Z-Buffer support for the renderer #7520
- [x] Split shadow sprites #3571
- [x] Installation from CD #3883 and asset download #3888 including music #8161 
- [x] Installation of Firestorm assets from CD and download. #12429
- [x] Turrets attaching to walls #4970
- [x] Radar dishes that stop spinning on low power #5138
- [x] Remappable resources #5155
- [x] Idle overlay sprite support #3681
- [x] Overlays that only animate with active production #5134
- [x] Construction yard crane overlay #5124
- [x] Voxel harvester unload animation #5797
- [x] Harvesting sprite animations #3458, #7204
- [x] Building plugins (components) #7812
- [x] Resource splattering for destroyed units containing Tiberium #2346
- [x] Hovering #7033
- [x] EMP
  - [x] stun actors #6653
  - [x] overlay animation #8581
  - [x] but as a super weapon #7349
- [x] AlphaImage support #7853
- [ ] Ion storms #13953
  - [x] Lighting [#7863]
  - [ ] Disabling actors
  - [x] Lightning #7872
- [x] AmbientSound #7871
- [x] Individual weapon factory door overlays #7862
- [ ] Support for per-height-level ambient lighting [#3605]
- [x] Gates #9981
- [x] Subterranean movement (and detection of it) [#7777]
- [x] Make actor height customisable [#7717]
- [x] draw stealthed actors semi-translucent instead of in shadow color #8996
- [x] Carryalls to manually pick up and release units #8954
- [x] Laser Fence logic #6072, #10790
- [ ] Firestorm generator logic and effects #10789
- [x] Voxel image changing when moving over water terrain type (for amphibious APC) #7981
- [ ] Particle effect system (damage/wielding sparks, railgun, gas clouds, smoke) #13956
- [x] WithChargeOverlay (for Obelisk) #7982
- [x] Tunnel system [#6410]
- [ ] High Bridges [#8917]
- [x] Refactor missiles [#7509]
  - [x] Airburst for missiles
  - [ ] Weapon spawning from airburst
  - [x] Projectile (missile) acceleration
  - [x] Customisable cruise altitude for missiles (and support for arcing flight curve) [#3736]
- [ ] Add support for voxel projectiles [#7673]
- [ ] Add support for voxel debris
- [x] Improved LaserZap (more fine-grained "facings" for start/end of lines) #8009
- [ ] Damage at current projectile coordinate during flight (for flamethrower)
- [x] Line damage (for sonic zap and rail guns) [#4458]
- [ ] "Rocker" property for warheads (make voxels 'rock' on impact) #13949
- [ ] Deforming terrain by weapons #13951
- [ ] Meteors #13950
- [ ] Small visceroids fusing to a single large one #10791
- [ ] Drop Pods #13928 
- [ ] Hunter-Seeker logic (release as support power not individual units) #12918
- [ ] Waypoints #10470
- [ ] Ice cracking logic [#8918]
- [ ] Veinhole logic #9690
  - [ ] Vein rendering #9688
  - [ ] Veins recede after veinhole destroyed #9689
  - [x] Veins should damage vehicles and buildings #9690
  - [ ] Gas projectile when attacked #9691.
- [ ] Chemical missiles [#7775]
- [ ] Cluster missiles [#7773]
- [ ] Component Towers/Gates can be placed on walls, replacing them #12088
- [ ] Actor acceleration/deceleration, as well as speed modifiers for moving up/down a slope #13954
- [ ] More control over some AI aspects (squad composition, probability of squad type, etc.) #9021
- [ ] Significantly improved [Pathfinding performance](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen%20label%3APerformance%20label%3APathfinding)
- [ ] Train logic (movement restricted to tracks) #2652
- [ ] Tiberium explosion chain reaction  #13955
- [ ] Forest fires (if tree burns, nearby trees can catch fire) #6403
- [x] Bouncy bullets (disc thrower)
- [x] Jumpjets <s>(might be doable with existing logic)</s> #12577
- [x] Armory (inf enters, returns as veteran, might be doable with existing logic) #8210
- [x] Hospital (hurt inf goes in, exits healed) #10363
- [ ] Ion cannon ripple effect
- [x] Cyborg logic (permanently lose legs when brought to low health once) #8261
- [ ] configurable tilt/roll/pitch angle for voxel aircraft #13947
- [ ] Tiberium fiends logic (run to Tiberium and lay down to heal) #13946
- [ ] auto-deploy attacks (artillery, tick tanks) #13039
- [x] Wakes #5858
- [ ] destructible cliffs #13829
- [ ] `NoMovingFire=yes` support #2327
- [x] Harvester docking overlay sprite #10364
- [ ] Scripted map bound changes #8221 etc.
- [ ] Waterfall terrain animations #13929
- [ ] Concrete plates / pavement #7878
- [x] Differentiate between Cabal/EVA voices and Nod/GDI icons #8799
- [ ] Vehicle tilting on slopes and bumps #9012
- [x] Right-click switch scrolling #9518
- [x] Eject cargo on destruction #3768

This list is probably far from complete.

data.title: Replace old "country" and "race" name in the code with the generic "faction"
data.body:
I finally got around to doing this.
I replaced all occurrences of "country", "countries", "race" and "races" with "faction" in file names, type names, code and UI-related YAML.
Still need to add **a ton** of YAML upgrade code to upgrade the actor rules.

I will probably squash the commits once everything is done, because they are _a lot_.

Closes  #7552.

data.title: Screen horizontal lines glitch + black border at top + mouse position off
data.body:
I found that on one computer OpenRA was nearly unusable. Things i noticed:
- the menu mouse pointer Y position is off. Mouseover and clicks correspond though.
- the menu dropdown-fields scroll buttons are unresponsive (not even mouseover). Hence i cant select an AI to skirmish with.
- there where horizontal line glitches. As if every ~30 pixels one line was missing. Especially noticeablewhen the menu shell map is scrolling, but also in the OpenRA logo.
- when in Pseudo-Fullscreen / Fullscreen i saw a black bar at the top of the screen.

I tried every combination of Pseudo-Fullscreen / Fullscreen / Windowed with Hardware Cursor and found no solution. With the latter the mouse Y offset varies though. 

See attached screenshot: demonstrating most of the above:
![openra screenshot 3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1420588/6997244/fc42386c-dbb4-11e4-9d68-876e2a111a45.png)
_(the mouse actually was above Mods button, despite mouseover)_

I was unable to screencapture fullscreen (i reported that to #5317), but i can say the mouse can enter black bar. I also suspect the black bar height corresponds with the number of horizontal line glitches, and it appears the mouse Y position is less off when near the bottom of the screen. It all seems interrelated.

Tested on release-20141029 and playtest-20150329. I cant remember seeing the problem before that.
Computer specs: Windows Vista SP2 64bits, native resolution 1360x768, Geforce G210.

PS. I am a programmer and willing to troubleshoot this myself, in case i might be the only one that can replicate this so far. Any insights welcome!
I would like to play OpenRA while spending weekends with my in laws. :)

_UPDATE: better screenshot and added indication_
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/10513504-screen-horizontal-lines-glitch-black-border-at-top-mouse-position-off?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

```
OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/World/TerrainGeometryOverlay.cs(51,60): error CS0172: Type of conditional expression cannot be determined as `byte' and `int' convert implicitly to each other` 
```

on Mono 2.10

data.title: Added a global palette effect for day/night lighting
data.body:
Add the following to any `map.yaml` which defaults to night:

``` yaml
Rules:
    World:
        GlobalPaletteEffect:
```

and if you are not epileptic try

``` yaml
Rules:
    World:
        GlobalPaletteEffect:
            Flash: true
```

data.title: Fixed the Tiberian Sun weapon factory doors
data.body: They will now open and show the insides properly with a new modular render overlay trait. `RenderBuildingWarFactory` was too hard-coded to the Red Alert and Tiberian Dawn sprites.

data.title: Add folders to custom Maps
data.body:
Now you can add folders for shps, vxls, palettes and audio files in your custom map. But the text in map.yaml is very confusing (if you have many rules and sequences). 

It would be nice if you are allowed to create rules.yaml and sequences.yaml in external folders like in mod.yaml is possible.

![7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5711422/6993303/6358c8ec-daf0-11e4-8305-70481661c1f0.jpg)

data.title: Add .png support
data.body:
I hate to create shps.

With the 256 colors from temperate.pal you have horrible pictures. You can create your own palette bur it takes very long time and the pictures are not perfect. It takes many of hours to create a good shp from a png file. 

It would be great if you can put png files in OpenRA.
- Easy created
- Many colors / good quality
- Opacity in every color
- Easy to read / write and modify

![5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5711422/6993244/821eb7ac-daee-11e4-91f6-7db2dbd4a857.jpg)

data.title: Print GLSL info log if shader compilation fails
data.body: The GL info log is written to graphics.log when shaders fail to compile or link. This info log contains compiler errors along with line numbers that explain why the shader failed to compile. Refactoring vertex & fragment shader compilation into a new function  also fixed fragment shader not being checked for errors (obvious copy-paste bug in the original Shader.cs, line 56). Someone with more knowledge can tell how to output the error message more nicely.

data.title: Add internal version number in custom maps
data.body:
If you have to many maps from the same author (only different versions) it spams your map chooser. May it's better if you see only one version of the Map (the newest) and by clicking you see all versions,

![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5711422/6993219/d1bfe20a-daed-11e4-826a-caa72675b479.jpg)

![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5711422/6993222/d6a67eb4-daed-11e4-94c1-c8b7fb90db2d.jpg)

data.title: SupportPowers are outside the screen
data.body:
If you have to many SupportPowers they are outside the display.
It would be better if OpenRA creates new columns (depending on display resolution).

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5711422/6993180/bb99e85a-daec-11e4-9f76-81e70d674ead.jpg)

data.title: Added AlphaImage support
data.body:
Initial support for http://modenc.renegadeprojects.com/AlphaImage which is basically a grey scale palette and a configurable background index (middle not start is neutral/transparent here) yet.

The result does not look too impressive yet, but I guess it is a start:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/6992134/47b89ab0-dabc-11e4-85bb-f26b5987d4fc.png)

data.title: Fixed GASPOT again
data.body:
Lot's of regressions introduced in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7776.
- Fixed missing make animation
- Fixed crash due to missing icon
- Fixed missing player color remap
- Fixed crash: TypeDictionary does not contain instance of type `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ValuedInfo`
- Fixed shroud revealing
- Fixed not being buildable with cheats on

data.title: Added status messages to console output for dedicated servers
data.body: as wished in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6913.

data.title: Tried to cache AppVeyor downloads
data.body: According to http://www.appveyor.com/docs/build-cache everything but chocolatey packages may be cached. I see the downloads failing the build annoyingly often. Hope this helps.

data.title: Add new enemy detection voice notifications to RA and D2k
data.body:
As yet another attempt to address people's issues with the "Enemy units approaching" notifications that both RA and D2k provide us with, deniz1a created some new notifications, which should be better suited for the task:
"Enemy units detected" in D2k and
"Enemy detected" in RA.
Now, we may or may not want to go with "Enemy units detected" in RA as well, I'll leave that up for discussion.
I converted the to .wav and uploaded here for easier testing:
[Atreides](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ao4us7b20o6myf0/AI_ENEMY_DETECTED.wav)
[Harkonnen](https://www.dropbox.com/s/yyb21agsfyoa8s5/HI_ENEMY_DETECTED.wav)
[Ordos](https://www.dropbox.com/s/a5i8a3ddzmz7u0g/OI_ENEMY_DETECTED.wav)
[RA](https://www.dropbox.com/s/r2357sht2902otc/enmydet.wav)

Also if anyone wants an easy way to hear the original files but doesn't have an appropriate tool, [this one](http://d2kplus.com/audioconverter.php) works pretty well.

I will probably add a commit that actually makes use of these tomorrow.
